    • Simulating cages

Simulate cages with the same starting conditions.

Source: R/fit_models.R
sim_cages.Rd

Simulate cages with the same starting conditions.

sim_cages(N_0, max_t, R, A, D_slope, D_inter, process_error, plant_mort_coefs,
  plant_death_age, plant_repl, n_reps, n_chains = 1, ...)

Arguments

N_0

Matrix of # aphids at time t=0. Should be matrix of size n_plants x n_lines.
max_t

Time steps per cage. Single integer.
R

Max growth rates per aphid line. Vector of length n_lines.
A

Density dependence per aphid line. Vector of length n_lines.
D_slope

Dispersal slope per aphid line. Vector of length n_lines.
D_inter

Dispersal intercept per aphid line. Vector of length n_lines.
process_error

SD of process error. Single double.
plant_mort_coefs

Coefficients (b0, then b1) for aphid mortality after plant starts dying.
plant_death_age

Number of days after which a plant starts dying.
plant_repl

Data frame containing two columns, the first indicating the date of replacement, the second indicating the plant that gets replaced on that date. There should be no repeat plants per date, but multiple plants can be replaced on the same date.
n_reps

Number of reps (i.e., cages) per chain.
n_chains

Number of chains to use. Note that values >1 will result in extra info being printed to the console. You can ignore this. Defaults to 1.
...

Other options passed to rstan::sampling().

Contents

  • Arguments
